case_vignette:
An otherwise healthy 60-year-old dishwasher presents with asymptomatic green discoloration of his right middle fingernail over a period of 2 months. The discoloration began from the distal margin. He denies wearing gloves while working and reports a tendency to pick at his nails when nervous. On examination, distal onycholysis and green discoloration are present exclusively on the right middle nail plate starting from the distal edge without signs of paronychia. Dermoscopy reveals pigment localization under the nail plate. The patient is a 60-year-old dishwasher who works in a restaurant kitchen. He is otherwise healthy and has no history of nail trauma or systemic disease. The patient is a non-smoker and does not use nail polish. The patient is a 60-year-old dishwasher who works in a restaurant kitchen. He is otherwise healthy and has no history of nail trauma or systemic disease. The patient is a non-smoker and does not use nail polish.

I have green discoloration on my right middle fingernail that started from the edge.

Final Diagnosis: Green Nail Syndrome (Chloronychia)
